div.p: The technology department has set up WiFi access points at 6 locations throughout the school district (Bryant Junior HIgh School, Bryant Middle School, Collegeville Elementary, Davis Elementary, Hurricane Creek Elementary, and Springhill Elementary). The internet reaches the parking lot of the schools listed above. If you have a district-owned device, it will automatically connect. If […]

Bryant Schools will offer Grab-and-Go meals, for any child up to age 18. Children do not have to attend Bryant Schools to participate. Parents may pick up meals for their children. Arkansas Foodbank will provide food for the adult family members. The following schools will serve Grab-and-Go meals:Collegeville ElementaryDavis ElementaryHill Farm ElementaryHurricane Creek ElementaryParkway ElementarySalem […]

The Division of Elementary and Secondary Education has given us guidance and flexibility to make the best decision for our district to meet the needs of our students. Starting on Monday, April 6, as a district we will shift to an online instructional delivery and will no longer operate under the guidelines of our AMI […]

On Monday, April 6, Bryant’s kindergarten through 5th grade students will transition from AMI packets to online learning. Although Bryant Public Schools has been challenged by the issues that go along with having school while students are not physically present, our staff has met the challenge and completed an online instructional plan to provide the […]

If you are registering a student for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, please email newstudentregistration@nullbryantschools.org for more information. Si va a inscribir a un estudiante para el resto del año escolar 2019-20, envíe un correo electrónico a newstudentregistration@nullbryantschools.org para obtener más información.

div.p: Information about each individual school is available here! Each school’s website stays updated with the latest activities schools are participating in.

div.class: module_column tb-column col3-1 middle tb_8_column module_column_1 module_column_8-3-1 tb_ada277b

div.p: We use Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and Blackboard MyConnect to help you stay connected and up to date with the latest information.

div.class: module_column tb-column col3-1 last tb_8_column module_column_2 module_column_8-3-2 tb_3a6ee9c

div.p: Bryant Public Schools makes information easily accessible in accordance with the Website Requirement Act 228 of 2013.

div.class: themify_builder_row module_row clearfix repeat fullwidth module_row_5 themify_builder_8_row module_row_8-5 tb_a8b377f
module_column tb-column col4-2 first tb_8_column module_column_0 module_column_8-5-0 tb_3894eff

div.p: Strategic planning is necessary for any successful organization. While planning has taken place in a number of different forms within the district, the Bryant School Board wanted a comprehensive strategic plan to provide direction for the future. We believe this road map will move Bryant from a very good school district to our vision of becoming the state’s premier provider of educational services.

div.class: module_column tb-column col4-2 last tb_8_column module_column_1 module_column_8-5-1 tb_fefaaa9

div.p: A lot of fun and exciting things happen throughout the year in Bryant Public Schools. Stay up to date with the latest Good Things in our monthly newsletter!
